  3. Bebop

Past members

Jang Hyeri

Introduction

Bebop was a three-member female pop-rock band under HMI Entertainment. The name Bebop was derived from a genre of jazz, as well as being an abbreviation of "BE BEST OF POP". The band made their official debut on February 14, 2014, with the mini-album "Between Calm and Passion."

Before officially debuting the group was only performing with two members, A-Yeon and Juwoo, they released a collaboration single "Maem Maem" with Humming Urban Stereo on August 23, 2013. Sometime shortly after this two new members joined and left. Then sometime in October 2013, Jang Hyeri (known as Ji In at the time) was spotted playing as a member at a club performance. They then made their official debut on February 14, 2014, with the mini-album "Between Calm and Passion."

In 2015 the band was on Season 1 of Asia's Got Talent, making it to the semi-finals week 2 but ultimately being eliminated.

On the 18th of October 2015, Jang Hyeri (known as Ji In at the time) announced her departure from Bebop due to health problems, Juwoo also left around the same time. Their departure caused the group as a whole to be inactive with activity on their official group SNS only stopping in June 2016, it is presumed that the group disbanded in 2016. But much later in a Q&A video on A-Yeon's YouTube channel, she revealed that the band had officially disbanded in 2015.
